response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Transaction> it = collection.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: Yes, that's correct. You're creating a new iterator for the queue every time the loop iterates, which means you're creating a new reference to the first element of the queue every time. Instead, you should use the iterator's next() method to get the next element in the queue in each iteration of the loop.
